title: 11/2/2023 Senate Committee on Public Safety | Subcommittee on Fulton County Jail
summary:
Overview:
- This was a Georgia Senate Committee on Public Safety | Subcommittee on Fulton County Jail session focused on understanding the operations and responsibilities related to county jails in Georgia.

Key Actions:
- No bills were passed or referred during this session.

Bills Introduced (First Reading):
- None detected

Notable Moments:
- The session began with an opening prayer led by Senator Chuck Payne.
- Introductions were made by the committee members, highlighting their relevant backgrounds and experience.
- Chairman John Albers emphasized that this would be an educational process to better understand the various entities responsible for managing county jails.
- The Georgia Sheriffs' Association was the first presenter, with Executive Director Terry Norris providing an overview of the role of the sheriff's office in county jail operations.

Votes:
- No recorded votes were taken.

Attendance:
- A quorum of the committee members was present.

Adjournment:
- The session adjourned, with the chairman indicating there would be multiple committee meetings on this topic moving forward.
